intro: Vulpia brauniana, commonly known as Braun's veldtgrass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the grass family Poaceae and typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and roadsides. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny flowers. It is characterized by its ability to thrive in dry conditions and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Vulpia brauniana plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
